(58) 20613th October, 1958CABINETTHE QUEEN'S SPEECHES: THE OPENING OF parliament note by the Secretary of State for the Home Department andLord Privy seal i circulate a revised version of The Queen's Speech on the Opening ofParliament, which has been prepared in the light of the Cabinefs recent discussion(C.C. (58) 74th Conclusions, Minute 4).R. A. B.Home Office, S.W. 1,13th October, 1958. OPENING speech my Lords and Members of the House of commons I look forward with great pleasure to the tour of Canada which, with my Dear Husband, I shall carry out next summer. For nearly two hundred years the peoples of Canada and the United Kingdom have shared a common destiny. Itwill be our hope and endeavour that our stay amongst My People in Canada may help to deepen still further the friendship and co-operation between the two sistercountries.2. With My Dear Husband, I also look forward with much pleasure to ourstay in Ghana in the autumn of next year. I shall particularly welcome this opportunity of meeting My Peoples in this new Member Country of theCommonwealth [and in Sierra Leone and Gambia].3. In the spirit which inspired the recent Commonwealth Trade and EconomicConference at Montreal, My Government will seek to forge closer links within theCommonwealth, being mindful of the unique contribution which its members can make to the progress of human society. They will also continue to foster the prosperity of the oversea territories which are in their charge. Fresh legislation tomaintain the provision of financial assistance for Colonial development and welfarewill be laid before you.4. My Government will neglect no opportunity to promote the advance ofthe Colonial territories and the increasing association of their peoples with themanagement of their own affairs. They will maintain their endeavours to secure a settlement in Cyprus which will ensure a period of tranquillity and progressduring the next seven years. They are taking energetic steps to protect theemployment of the people of Malta and hope that, as a result of the forthcomingconstitutional discussions with the Maltese political parties, they will be able tointroduce legislation which will set the pattern of a stable and thriving future forthe Island.5. I look forward with great pleasure to the visit which the Shah of Iran will pay to this country next May.6. My Government will strive, by active support of the United Nations andof the Atlantic Alliance and other regional Pacts of which they are members, toplay their full part in preserving peace and justice and promoting economicwell-being and improved standards of life throughout the world. They will give their full co-operation to the United Nations and to the countries of the middle east in any constructive action which will both relieve international tension inthat sorely troubled area and take account of the needs and aspirations of itspeoples.7. As a result of expert discussions which were initiated by My Government,negotiations on the possibility of securing a controlled suspension of the testing of nuclear weapons are due to begin in Geneva on 31st October between my government and the Governments of the United States qf America and the soviet union. In agreement with the Government of the United States, My Governmenthave declared themselves ready to suspend such tests for one year from thebeginning of these negotiations provided that the Soviet Government observe asimilar obligation. In the same spirit My Government will continue to seek anagreement on disarmament in the hope that the dread of destruction may be liftedfrom the minds of our own and succeeding generations.Members of the House of commons. Estimates for the public services will be laid before you in due course.My Lords and Members of the House of commons. It will remain the resolve of My Ministers to ensure the stability of sterlingat home and abroad, and a high and stable level of employment. They will seek,in co-operation with the Commonwealth, to expand our overseas trade both inEurope, through the creation of a Free Trade Area, and throughout the world. 2TOP. SECRET,10V: A healthy and thriving agriculture will remain among the principalobjectives of My Government. Legislation will be introduced to enable special assistance to be given to small farmers and to provide for further support for theAgricultural Mortgage Corporation.11. A Bill will be laid before you for the protection and control of deer inScotland.12. [My Ministers will continue to assist and encourage the fishing industry:they are supporting in the United Nations a proposal that a Second world conference on the Law of the Sea should be convened at an early date in orderto resolve the issues concerning the territorial sea and fishing limits which were left unsettled at the earlier Conference at Geneva. It is their hope that a lastingsettlement of these problems, which are of serious concern to British fishermen, will result.]13. It will be the special concern of My government to introduce progressivemeasures to enhance the social well-being of My People. [Proposals will be laidbefore you for placing the National Insurance Fund on a sounder financial basis,and for a new approach to the provision of retirement pensions based on a measureof graduation in benefits and contributions.] Alternative [As a result of the examination which My Ministers have been making of the problems of provisionfor old age, proposals will be laid before you for introducing a measure of graduationinto National Insurance contributions and retirement pensions which will place thescheme on a sound financial basis and enable a larger section of My People to buildup pension rights related to their earnings.] Effect will be given to many of therecommendations of the Royal Commission relating to mental illness and mental deficiency; and the provisions of a new Bill will replace existing mental healthlegislation in England and Wales. My Ministers will introduce legislation to amendand strengthen the Factories Acts. A Bill will also be introduced to repeal the catering Wages Act and to convert into Wages Councils the four functioningCatering Wages Boards.14. My Government will continue to encourage the extension of facilities for higher education in the universities and technical colleges. [In addition they willannounce new plans designed to improve the scope and quality of secondary schooleducation.] Alternative--[In addition they will announce new plans for improving the nation's schools designed, in particular, to bring about a rapid development inthe scope and quality of secondary education.] [In order to enable the Churches inEngland and Wales to play a full part in this programme of expansion, you will beinvited to approve a Bill to increase the grants available to assist the improvementof the voluntary schools system.]15. My Government view with concern the increase in crime. They willcontinue to promote the study of the complex problems involved, with a view to improving the penal system and to developing and making more effective themethods of dealing with offenders.16. My Ministers will continue their endeavours to secure a just balance between the development of the public resources of a modern State and the freedomand comfort of the individual citizen. They will introduce a Bill to improve thebasis of compensation for compulsory acquisition of land [as well as legislation toprovide for the management of the New Towns in England and Wales as theyapproach completion]; and in pursuance of their policy for improving the housingof My People they will lay before you a measure to give further encouragement to house-purchase and ownership. Legislation will also be proposed to establish a modern code for the general regulation of building in Scotland.17. In continuation of their policy of ensuring that the traditional rights andliberties of My Subjects are safeguarded by permanent statute, My Ministers will allow certain economic controls deriving from emergency powers to lapse and will introduce legislation to authorise the temporary continuance of the remainder ina restricted form.My Lords and Members of the House of Commons19. To-day, for the first time in our long history, this ceremony is beingwitnessed not only by those who are present in this Chamber, but also by many millions of My Subjects in these Islands; and peoples in other lands will also be ableto share in this annual event in the life of Parliament. They will see, in the outward forms of pageantry, the symbols of authority and state; but they willsurely respond also to the spirit of hope and purpose with which a freepeople, bred in the tradition of democracy and protected by the law, turn afreshto face the challenge and the opportunity of the world to-day. In that same spiritI pray that the blessing of Almighty God may rest upon your counsels.
